DataSourceModuleType.Comment: creates an instance of Enterprise License hosted by Windows Computer

DisplayString.Name: Populate Microsoft Internet Information Services Server Computer Group
DisplayString.Description: This Discovery Rule discovers and populates the Windows Internet Information Services Computer group named “IIS Computer Group” with instances of computers that are running any version of Microsoft Windows Internet Information Services.

DisplayString.Name: Web Server - Active Server Pages\Request Not Found
DisplayString.Description: This Performance View displays performance data for Active Server Pages\Request Not Found.

DisplayString.Name: Web Server - Active Server Pages\Requests Queued
DisplayString.Description: This Performance View displays performance data for Active Server Pages\Requests Queued.

DisplayString.Name: Web Server - Active Server Pages\Requests/Sec
DisplayString.Description: This Performance View displays performance data for Active Server Pages\Request/Sec.

DisplayString.Name: Web Server - Active Server Pages\Request Wait Time
DisplayString.Description: This Performance View displays performance data for Active Server Pages\Request Wait Time.

DisplayString.Name: Active Alerts
DisplayString.Description: This Alerts View will display all unresolved Alerts for the associated class(s).

DisplayString.Name: All Performance Data
DisplayString.Description: This Performance View will display all performance data for the associated class(s)

DisplayString.Name: IIS Application Component
DisplayString.Description: All components that are part of an Microsoft Windows Internet Information Services (IIS) server installation.

DisplayString.Name: IIS Application Pool
DisplayString.Description: All IIS Application Pools regardless of the Internet Information Services (IIS) version.

DisplayString.Name: Application Pool State
DisplayString.Description: This State View will display State and Attributes for the associated class(s)

DisplayString.Name: IIS Application Pool Alerts
DisplayString.Description: This view displays all alerts for each IIS Application Pool instance.

DisplayString.Name: Application Pool Health
DisplayString.Description: This dashboard view displays monitoring status and information for the IIS Web Site.

DisplayString.Name: IIS Application Pool State
DisplayString.Description: This view displays state for each IIS Application Pool instance.

DisplayString.Name: Web Server – ASP.NET\Errors Total/Sec
DisplayString.Description: This Performance View displays performance data for ASP.NET\Errors Total/Sec.

DisplayString.Name: Web Server – ASP.NET\Request Queued
DisplayString.Description: This Performance View displays performance data for ASP.NET\Request Queued.

DisplayString.Name: Web Server – ASP.NET\Requests Current
DisplayString.Description: This Performance View displays performance data for ASP.NET\Requests Current.

DisplayString.Name: Web Server – ASP.NET\Requests/Sec
DisplayString.Description: This Performance View displays performance data for ASP.NET\Requests/Sec.

DisplayString.Name: Web Server – ASP.NET\Request Wait Time
DisplayString.Description: This Performance View displays performance data for ASP.NET\Request Wait Time.

DisplayString.Name: ASP.NET Application Endpoint
DisplayString.Description: ASP.NET Application Endpoint Class

DisplayString.Name: ASP.NET Web Service Endpoint
DisplayString.Description: ASP.NET Web Service Endpoint Class

DisplayString.Name: Windows Server Internet Information Services Library
DisplayString.Description: Microsoft Windows Server Internet Information Services Library: This management pack is the library management pack that defines all of the features and components that are common to all versions of Windows Server Internet Information Services.

DisplayString.Name: IIS Computer State
DisplayString.Description: This State View will display State and Attributes for the associated class(s)

DisplayString.Name: IIS Computer Group
DisplayString.Description: A group containing all Windows computers that are running a component of Microsoft Windows Internet Information Services (IIS).

DisplayString.Name: Disk Capacity
DisplayString.Description: This dashboard view displays Disk Capacity related performance data.

DisplayString.Name: Disk Performance
DisplayString.Description: This dashboard view displays Disk Performance related performance data.

DisplayString.Name: Disk Utilization
DisplayString.Description: This dashboard view displays Disk Utilization related performance data.

DisplayString.Name: IIS FTP Server

DisplayString.Description: This view displays all alerts for each IIS FTP Server instance.

DisplayString.Description: This dashboard view displays monitoring status and information for the IIS FTP Server.

DisplayString.Name: FTP Server Performance
DisplayString.Description: This Dashboard view will display Bytes Sent/Sec, Bytes Received/Sec, Bytes Total/Sec, and Current Connections performance data for the FTP Server.

DisplayString.Name: IIS FTP Server State
DisplayString.Description: This view displays state for each IIS FTP Server instance.

DisplayString.Name: IIS Discovery data source
DisplayString.Description: This Data Source discovers IIS in Windows Server.

DisplayString.Name: Generate an Enterprise License Object
DisplayString.Description: This Data Source discovers the IIS Enterprise License.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This Discovery Rule discovers and populates the Windows Internet Information Services Computer group named “IIS Computer Group” with instances of computers that are running any version of Microsoft Windows Internet Information Services.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: The Microsoft Windows Internet Information Services Library Management Pack provides the base monitoring related features (Managed Entities, Groups, Discovery, etc) that are required to monitor Internet Information Services Servers. This Library Management Pack must be imported before or during the import of the version specific Management Pack for Internet Information Services (for example; Internet Information Services 2003).

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This Discovery Rule discovers and populates the Windows Internet Information Services Type named “IIS Role” with instances of the Internet Information Services Server Role.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This Discovery Rule discovers and populates the Windows Internet Information Services group named “IIS Server Group” with instances of the Internet Information Services Server Role.
